channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Bitcoin Rises to Record on Optimism Around US Regulations
item.description: Bitcoin hit an all-time high after the advancement of stablecoin legislation in the US stoked hopes of regulatory clarity under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Suvashree Ghosh, Maria Clara Cobo

media:content.media:description: A logo for Bitcoin cryptocurrency at a cryptocurrency exchange.

item.title: New EU Plan Boosts Strategic Growth Sectors: Sejourne
item.description: European Commission Vice-President Stephane Sejourne, who’s in charge of the bloc’s industrial strategy, comments on plans to boost strategic sectors like technology, pharmaceuticals, auto manufacturing, aluminum and steel. The Commission, the European Union’s executive arm, unveiled on Wednesday a strategy to remove barriers and foster cooperation among member states in the face of rising geopolitical tensions and a growing trade conflict with the US. Sejourne was speaking to Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook in Brussels. (French with English translation.) (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CME in Talks to Set Up Hong Kong Warehouse Following LME’s Move
item.description: Exchange operator CME Group Inc. has held talks with Hong Kong authorities to add it to its aluminum contracts physical delivery network, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Julian Luk, Archie Hunter

media:content.media:description: Aluminum ingots inside a furnace at the Tajima Light Metal Co. foundry in Hanyu, Saitama Prefecture, Japan, on Wednesday, May 14, 2025. Japan is scheduled to release its first-quarter gross domestic product (GDP) figures on May 16. Photographer: Toru Hanai/Bloomberg

item.title: Stocks Trim Slide as Alphabet Up 5%; Bitcoin Jumps: Markets Wrap
item.description: A rebound in some of the world’s largest technology companies pushed stocks away from session lows, though concerns about the US fiscal footing still lurked in the background - driving bonds and the dollar down.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: Google Brings AI Mode to Search
item.description: Alphabet’s Google announces changes to its search engine as it tries to stay competitive with rivals in AI. Liz Reid, VP and Head of Search at Google, talks with Bloomberg’s Jackie Davalos about the changes and why this isn't the end of blue links. They speak from Google I/O. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Big Tech Leads US Stock Rebound as Alphabet AI Event Lifts Mood
item.description: American technology giants led a recovery across US equities into afternoon trading Wednesday in the wake an artificial intelligence event hosted by Google- parent Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: BofA Tells Clients to Bet Against Mexico Peso as Recession Looms
item.description: Bank of America Corp. is telling clients to bet on declines in Mexico’s peso against the euro, warning of risks including an economic downturn at home and a proposed tax on remittances from the US.
item.dc:creator: Vinicius Andrade, Maria Elena Vizcaino

media:content.media:description: Exchange rate information displayed outside a currency exchange office in Mexico City, Mexico, on Tuesday, March 4, 2025. The Mexican peso slumped after US President Donald Trump imposed new import tariffs against the country, though other developing-nation currencies held their own amid concerns about the impact of the escalating trade war on growth in the world’s largest economy.

item.title: BlackRock Adds to AI-Stocks Bet in $160 Billion Model Portfolios
item.description: The world’s largest asset manager is adding to bets on the artificial intelligence within its US model portfolios while trimming its overall equity risk because of tariff uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Emily Graffeo

item.title: Oil Climbs on Report That Israel Is Preparing to Strike Iran
item.description: Oil swung as traders evaluated a CNN report that Israel is preparing to potentially strike Iranian nuclear facilities as well as data that showed an increase in US crude stockpiles.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Charleston

media:content.media:description: The Bushehr nuclear power plant in Bushehr province, Iran. Source: NurPhoto/NurPhoto

item.title: Hedge Fund Founder’s German Tax Fraud Money Laundering Charges Dropped
item.description: German money laundering charges against hedge fund founder Sanjay Shah in a €330 million ($374 million) case were dropped after his conviction in a similar Danish prosecution.
item.dc:creator: Karin Matussek

item.title: LVMH Said to Warn of Continued Luxury Weakness on China Woes
item.description: LVMH is warning investors and analysts that demand remains soft after the luxury conglomerate missed revenue estimates for the first three months of the year, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Angelina Rascouet, Julien Ponthus

media:content.media:description: A Christian Dior store in Beijing.

item.title: Bull Market Is Alive and Well, Says Evercore’s Emanuel
item.description: Julian Emanuel, Evercore ISI Chief Equity Derivatives and quant strategist says that the bull market is alive and well, thanks to artificial intelligence. He joined Bloomberg Open Interest with his insights. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Don't Focus on the Noise in Housing, Says PGIM's Marcus
item.description: Mortgage rates in the US are once again approaching the dreaded 7 percent. That marks the highest level since February. Elevated borrowing costs are driving a decline in applications for home purchases and refinancing. Cathy Marcus, Co-CEO and Global COO at PGIM Real Estate joined Bloomberg Open Interest from its annual Global Client Conference in Miami. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Elliott Set to Win Two Phillips 66 Board Seats in Proxy Fight
item.description: Phillips 66 shareholders are set to elect two of Elliott Investment Management’s nominees to its board, in the first ever US proxy vote for the activist investor.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Risser, Liana Baker

media:content.media:description: A Phillips 66 Los Angeles refinery in Wilmington, California.

item.title: Milei Stumbles in Bid to Unchain Farmers as Soy Tax Break Ends
item.description: President Javier Milei’s vow to unleash Argentina’s beleaguered farmers is faltering after a decision to raise taxes on soy exports by about seven percentage points.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Gilbert

media:content.media:description: A combine harvester cuts through a field of soybean plants in San Jose de la Esquina, Argentina.

item.title: MENA & Crypto: What Comes Next?
item.description: Yousef Mohamed Al-Jaida, CEO, Qatar Financial Centre; Ola Doudin, Co-Founder & CEO, BitOasis; and Emmanuel Givanakis, CEO, Financial Services Regulatory Authority, Abu Dhabi Global Market discuss investing in crypto and the evolving future of digital assets with Bloomberg’s Anna Irrera at the 2025 Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: H.E. Hassan Al Thawadi on Vision, Impact & Legacy
item.description: H.E. Hassan Al Thawadi, Managing Director, Supreme Committee for Delivery and Legacy speaks with Bloomberg's Jason Kelly at the 2025 Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump's Embrace of Bitcoin Drives It Higher: Novogratz
item.description: Billionaire Michael Novogratz, CEO of Galaxy Digital Holdings Ltd., says the Trump administration's embrace of Bitcoin is driving the cryptocurrency higher. He speaks on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tariffs Expected to Trigger More Market Volatility
item.description: Ali Dibadj, CEO of Janus Henderson Investors, joined the C-Suite on Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about how the geopolitical trade realignment will hit global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Dollar Hits One-Month Low as G-7 Stirs Fresh FX Policy Watch
item.description: A gauge of the dollar fell to its lowest mark in a month as traders awaited a Group-of-Seven meeting this week for any signs that the Trump administration is seeking a weaker US currency.
item.dc:creator: Vassilis Karamanis, David Finnerty

item.title: Ontario to Spend $2.2 Billion on Indigenous Role in Mining
item.description: The Ontario government will spend nearly C$3.1 billion ($2.2 billion) to encourage Indigenous participation in the mining industry, in a bid to ramp up critical minerals production across Canada’s most populous province.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Lorinc, Stephanie Hughes

media:content.media:description: Stephen Lecce, Ontario's education minister, speaks during a swearing-in ceremony at Queens Park in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, on Friday, June 24, 2022. Ontario Premier Doug Ford announced his new cabinet today, after cruising to a second victory as Ontario's premier, cementing his control over the province that represents 40% of Canada’s economy.

item.title: Novogratz Says SEC Under Biden Was 'Un-American'
item.description: Billionaire Michael Novogratz, CEO of Galaxy Digital Holdings Ltd. says the US Securities and Exchange Commission under President Joe Biden was "un-American" and unfair. He says it took more than 1,000 days to finally go public on the Nasdaq. Galaxy started trading there on Friday. He also talks about Bitcoin hitting a new record, the need for regulatory clarity and possibly turning Galaxy's shares into tokens. He speaks on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Treasury Yields Climb, Auguring 5% Rate for 20-Year Bond Auction
item.description: Treasuries extended a selloff fueled by investor anxiety about the growth in the US’s financing need, propelling longer maturities beyond 5% ahead of an auction of new 20-year bonds.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie

media:content.media:description: The White House and the US Treasury building in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, Feb. 24, 2025. Elon Musk’s demand that more than two million federal employees defend their work is facing pushback from other powerful figures in the Trump administration, in a sign that the billionaire’s brash approach to overhauling the government is creating division.

item.title: Saudi Airline Flynas Draws $109 Billion In Orders for IPO
item.description: Saudi Arabia’s Flynas Co. attracted about 410 billion riyals ($109 billion) in orders for its $1.1 billion initial public offering, underscoring strong investor appetite for Middle Eastern listings.
item.dc:creator: Laura Gardner Cuesta

media:content.media:description: A plane from the low-cost Saudi carrier flynas taxies on the tarmac at the King Khalid International Airport in Riyadh on January 12, 2017.

item.title: Deglobalization’s Threat to the Bond Market
item.description: A perfect recipe for inflation.
item.dc:creator: Joe Weisenthal, Tracy Alloway

media:content.media:description: South Korean 50,000 won banknotes prepared at the Bank of Korea headquarters ahead of the Lunar New Year in Seoul, South Korea, on Tuesday, Jan. 14, 2025. The currency could slide to the key psychological level of 1,500 per dollar, a level last reached 16 years ago, after tumbling to 1,486 last month, according to Malayan Banking Bhd. and Mizuho Securities. Photographer: SeongJoon Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: World Crazy for Chicken Is Losing Its Biggest Supplier
item.description: The detection of bird flu in a single poultry farm in southern Brazil is reverberating around the world, cutting supplies to voracious consumers from China to Europe.
item.dc:creator: Clarice Couto, Gerson Freitas Jr

media:content.media:description: A commercial poultry farm, site of Brazil's first bird flu outbreak, in Montenegro, Rio Grande do Sul state, Brazil.

item.title: Meloni Looks to Moody’s to End Italy’s Near-Junk Status
item.description: Italy is just two days away from the chance to start shaking off the near-junk status that has hung over Giorgia Meloni’s premiership.
item.dc:creator: Alessandra Migliaccio

item.title: The Biggest Market Risks to Your Summer Vacation
item.description: Stuart Kaiser, head of equity trading strategy at Citi, runs down what he sees as the top market risks for investors to be aware of over the summer. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: A Partnership That May Change Future of EV Charging
item.description: ChargePoint and power management company Eaton are announcing a partnership to accelerate and simplify the deployment of EV charging infrastructure. Rick Wilmer, ChargePoint President & CEO joined Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about the deal. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Musk Addresses USAID Cuts, Vows to ‘Fix’ HIV Initiative
item.description: Elon Musk, the co-founder and chief executive officer of Tesla Inc., talks about cuts to USAID made by the Department of Government Efficiency and addresses the disputed disruption of an initiative to combat HIV. He spoke on May 20 via video link to Bloomberg's Mishal Husain at the Qatar Economic Forum in Doha. The government of the State of Qatar is the underwriter of the Qatar Economic Forum, powered by Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)
